name: example_script

classes.name: Operation
classes.simplified_code:
class Operation(Enum):
    ADD = "Add"
    SUBTRACT = "Subtract"
    MULTIPLY = "Multiply"
    DIVIDE = "Divide"
    POWER = "Power"

classes.name: CalculatorBlock

functions.name: __init__
functions.simplified_code:
def __init__(self):
        super().__init__(
            id="b1ab9b19-67a6-406d-abf5-2dba76d00c79",
            input_schema=CalculatorBlock.Input,
            output_schema=CalculatorBlock.Output,
            description="Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers.",
            categories={BlockCategory.LOGIC},
            test_input={
                "operation": Operation.ADD.value,
                "a": 10.0,
                "b": 5.0,
                "round_result": False,
            },
            test_output=[
                ("result", 15.0),
            ],
        )

blocks.label: super().__init__(id="b1ab9b19-67a6-406d-abf5-2dba76d00c79", input_schema=CalculatorBlock.Input, output_schema=CalculatorBlock.Output, description="Performs a mathematical operation on two numbers.", categories={BlockCategory.LOGIC}, test_input={"operation": Operation.ADD.value, "a": 10.0, "b": 5.0, "round_result": False}, test_output=[("result", 15.0)])

classes.name: CountItemsBlock

functions.name: __init__
functions.simplified_code:
def __init__(self):
        super().__init__(
            id="3c9c2f42-b0c3-435f-ba35-05f7a25c772a",
            input_schema=CountItemsBlock.Input,
            output_schema=CountItemsBlock.Output,
            description="Counts the number of items in a collection.",
            categories={BlockCategory.LOGIC},
            test_input={"collection": [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]},
            test_output=[
                ("count", 5),
            ],
        )
